intro: Diporochna gilgii, commonly known as the Gilgii's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are typically arranged in umbellate inflorescences. The plant is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
